thread.title: Russian Instagram model Viktoria Odintcova hauled before police after dangling from Dubai skyscraper | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Russian Instagram model Viktoria Odintcova hauled before police after dangling from Dubai skyscraper | London Evening Standard

author: Hatty Collier
title: Russian Instagram model Viktoria Odintcova hauled before police after dangling from Dubai skyscraper | London Evening Standard
text:
David Baddiel explores his father's dementia in The Trouble With Dad 
An Instagram model was hauled before police after she diced with death by dangling from one of the world’s tallest skyscrapers for a photoshoot. 
Viktoria Odintcova, 22, was ordered to sign a written statement pledging not to repeat the stunt which she had carried out in Dubai , the Sun reported. 
Ms Odintcova posed for a photo as she clung to the hand of a male assistant after climbing over the edge of the 1,000ft tall tower. 
The model also leant backwards over the edge of the skyscraper with one arm outstretched for another shot. A post shared by Viki Odintcova (@viki_odintcova) on Feb 3, 2017 at 7:12am PST 
Major General Halil Ibragim Al-Mansuri, of the Dubai Police, told the newspaper: "The actions of the Russian woman put her life at risk." 
Ms Odintcove had posted the photos and videos on her Instagram account which has more than three million followers. 
She wrote: “I still can’t believe I did it. Every time I watch the video my palms go sweaty.” A post shared by Viki Odintcova (@viki_odintcova) on Jan 26, 2017 at 6:55am PST 
The photoshoot took place at the top of Dubai’s Cayan Tower which is 73 storeys high and was the world’s tallest building when it opened in 2013. 
But some of the models fans were unimpressed and slammed the “reckless” stunt. 
One person commented on her Instagram post: “Crazy! Looks like god gave you beauty but seems like he forgot to grace you with a brain.”
